channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pathway is worn down in several places, 20th August
item.description:
The pathway is worn down in several places. It is a busy route to school and is becoming more challenging with pushchairs and small wheels.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Glynrosa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Street light number 12 is not working, 20th August
item.description:
On Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham, street light number 12 is not working. This was broken last year but you managed to get the developer responsible to fix it (it is on a public thoroughfare, NOT a development or housing association site). However, it is not working again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tipping of waste garden cuttings and branches, 19th August
item.description:
Wellington Lane outside Rosehill House and behind Anlaby Court garages. I can not get my car out of my garage due this obstructing the road. It is also blowing around now and some of it is in the road and in front of my garage. Please can this be removed as last time this happened it was followed by more as people just see it as a dumping place. It has been there for over two weeks now and the more it dries out the more is blowing around. There are rats there as well and I don’t want them nesting outside my gate where my dog might get bitten.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially dangerous tree, 19th August
item.description:
At the junction between Hatherley Lane and Wade Court there is a small wooded area with mature trees. One of those trees has today had a large branch split off and fall into my garden. The tree itself seems very unsteady, and I am worried that it might be in danger of falling. It also touches the side of my house
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly parked vehicles need urgent attention, 19th August
item.description:
Roberts Road Prestbury is having resurfacing so residents have parked in Noverton Avenue and Noverton Lane. This is on a bus route and the parked cars have not left adequate passing places. Also some are parked dangerously close to the junctions particularly Noverton Avenue creating a blind spot. Refuse collection is due Wednesday morning so they may have difficulty turning in. Please put some cones on the junctions and down the lane to ensure traffic can travel up and down safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7a, Noverton Avenue, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedgerow, 19th August
item.description:
I am writing on behalf of some constituents who live in the park homes along Orchard Park, Green Lane in Hucclecote, who have raised their concerns in relation to overgrowing trees and brambles, as well as rubbish that has been left in the area. One resident in particular is having issues with the overgrowth coming over their fence and causing them issues. I would be grateful if you could pass this onto the relevant team. I have already confirmed with the Highways team that this area does not fall under their remit. The what3words are deal.pine.finds. If you need anything further, please let me know and I look forward to hearing from you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Park, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
